reviews.text: Unfortunately, had to wait in a long queue to buy tickets on a bank holiday weekend as no conductor on train, and only one person selling tickets before going through barrier. Staff should exercise more common sense and allow passengers to purchase tickets at ticket office and not insult people by suggesting they might run off without paying.  This is poor customer service.
Staff not very helpful, friendly or knowledgeable. Seems to be long queues most of the time and the automatic ticket machines always seems to have issues. A lot of improvements required.
My home town, so love it

Good old Victorian seaside town. Lots of hotels, guest houses and holiday flats. It has a pier and donkey rides on the beach. Playgrounds for the kids and a nice long promenade to take a brisk walk. There are numerous bars and restraunts along the streets serving a variety of food to suit all tastes. Especially nice when the sun is out. Had a great day here last Friday visiting family. Very busy considering it was late February, but surprisingly warm in the winter sun!!
Great station has great connections with London, Bristol, Exeter, Plymouth, Penzance, Cardiff, Manchester and Burmingham.
